intro: Hainanecio hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan ecio, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
